author: Special Correspondent
text:
Ten workers were killed and three others injured in a major fire in Jammu’s Ramban on Friday morning.

The bodies will undergo DNA testing for identification.

The fire emanated in the barracks of the tunnel workers in Ramban’s Chanderkote area early Friday morning.

The victims were working on the Nasra tunnel on the Jammu-Srinagar national highway.

Several residential quarters, occupied by workers, were gutted in the incident.

“The victims died due to asphyxiation and burn injuries. The dead include earth mover operators, helpers and labourers from Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and different places of Jammu and Kashmir,” said Senior Superintendent of Police Randip Kumar. Out of ten, only one victim could be identified as Rakesh Kumar, a resident of Himachal Pradesh.

“DNA matching will be done on the bodies and thereafter handed over to their relative,” said a senior police official. Three others are undergoing treatment for severe burn injuries.
title: Ten workers killed in J&K fire
